pros: Friendly colleagues and many members of staff truly care about the job.
cons: - Not very flexible or willing to make adjustments for additional needs of staff (do go above and beyond for students) - Reluctant to hire more staff that are needed to replace those who have left and instead add it to your workload without raising wages - Nowhere for staff to eat lunch on-site apart from in canteen or at desk (rarely get full hour without being disturbed) - It's definitely a 'who you know' culture - expect to be passed over for a promotion because someone else is friends/family with management - Nowhere near enough parking - have to get there an hour early just to get a spot
Senior management are devoid of any knowledge of staff problems, too many directors that do not contribute.

review_title: If you have integrity and want to help, you will be beaten down by managers ticking boxes
pros: Honestly fantastic to help the students achieve, I loved working and helping the students better themselves for their futures
cons:
Senior leadership and managers who just pander to those above without questioning poor practice or just bad ideas. 
Constant over paid new CEOs who just move around the country pretending they know best, just being fake, asking for ideas to save the college then do the absolute opposite.
SLT and constant sycophants with zero ideas, so frustrating that great staff leave. Such a shame and only the students are affected.

review_title: Poorly managed but good individual departments.
Some great work goes on but a poor SLT is demoralising the workforce.
job_title: Lecturer in Kingston upon Hull, East Riding of Yorkshire, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: Great colleagues and students, very good middle management within my department.
cons: Poor SLT, poor remuneration, too many variable hours contracts, excessive paperwork.

job_title: Lecturer in Kingston upon Hull, East Riding of Yorkshire, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: Enjoy teaching and it's a pleasure to work with some really dedicated staff.
cons: Under constant threat of redundancy. Work load is increasing and many good people jumping ship (or looking to)

pros: Friendly staff and  nice environment to work
